com.astamuse.asta4d.web.form.flow.classical

Interface ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Superinterfaces:
    BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, CascadeArrayFunctions, FormFlowTraceDataAccessor, UpdatableFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, ValidationProcessor
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultiInputStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>

    public interface ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>
extends UpdatableFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>
    This trait represents a classical flow that contains input/confirm/complete steps.

    By default, this trait can handle a page with classical 3 steps: input, confirm and complete. The developers are required to at least implement the following methods:

    • BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait.getFormCls()
    • BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait.createInitForm()
    • updateForm(Object)
    The base folder of template files for each step could be specified in the URL rule by the fixed name of VAR_TEMPLATE_BASE_PATH.

    Also, ValidationProcessor.getTypeUnMatchValidator() and ValidationProcessor.getValueValidator() are recommended to be overridden by a common parent class to perform validator configuration.

    Further methods can be overridden for more flexible flow definition. See details of the description of each method.

    If there are more than one input step, the following methods can (for most cases, should) be overridden to customize the multiple steps:

    • BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait.generateFormInstanceFromContext(String)
    • #validateForm(FormProcessData, Object)
    • BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait.rewriteTraceDataBeforeGoSnippet(String, String, FormFlowTraceData)
    • skipStoreTraceData(String, String, FormFlowTraceData)
    Author:
    e-ryu

      • treatCompleteStepAsExit

        default boolean treatCompleteStepAsExit()
        Sub classes should decide whether they want to show a complete page or simply exit current flow.

        The default is false, which means the complete page will be shown always.

        Returns:

      • skipStoreTraceData

        default boolean skipStoreTraceData(String currentStep,
                                   String renderTargetStep,
                                   FormFlowTraceData traceData)
        In the parent class BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait's implementation of saveTraceMap, it says that the sub class have the responsibility to make sure save the trace map well, thus we override it to perform the obligation. The trace map will not be saved when the flowing cases:
        • The form flow starts and the first step is shown as the entry of current flow
        • The form flow is returned to the first step from the first step (usually validation failed).
        • The form flow is returned to the first step from other step when the #skipSaveTraceMapWhenBackedFromOtherStep() returns true
        • The form flow has finished and is moving to the finish step.
        From parent:

        Since we are lacking of necessary step information to judge if we should save or not, we only do the basic judgment for the init step. The sub class have the responsibility to handle other cases.

        Specified by:
        skipStoreTraceData in interface FormFlowTraceDataAccessor
        Parameters:
        currentStep -
        renderTargetStep -
        traceMap -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait#skipSaveTraceData(String, String, FormFlowTraceData)

      • getTemplateBasePath

        default String getTemplateBasePath()
        Sub class can override this method to return the base path of target template files. By default, it retrieves the value from pathvar scope of context by key VAR_TEMPLATE_BASE_PATH.
        Returns:

      • retrieveFormInstance

        default T retrieveFormInstance(FormFlowTraceData traceData,
                               String currentStep)
        This method defines the default policy of how to retrieve the form instance for current step. For confirm/complete step, we will always retrieve the form instance from the traceMap which have stored the form instance for current step at last step (when #passDataToSnippet(String, String, Map) was invoked), for other steps, the parent's implementation will be invoked.

        From parent:

        Sub classes can override this method to customize how to retrieve the form instance by step information. By default, a form instance will be retrieved from context by calling BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait.generateFormInstanceFromContext(String).

        Specified by:
        retrieveFormInstance in interface BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>
        Returns:

      • passDataToSnippetByFlash

        default boolean passDataToSnippetByFlash(String currentStep,
                                         String renderTargetStep,
                                         FormFlowTraceData traceData)
        When the form flow finished, if the complete page rendering is skipped(treatCompleteStepAsExit() returns true), we have to pass data to snippet via flash scope since we have to exit the current flow and the current request will be redirect by a 302 response.

        From parent:

        Sub classes should tell us whether we should pass data to snippet via flash scope. The default is false.

        Specified by:
        passDataToSnippetByFlash in interface BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>
        Returns:
        true when step is complete and treatCompleteStepAsExit() returns true
